item.title: Re: Tags
item.content:encoded:
Sam510 is right. We will only use generic tags. That is the point of tags for that matter.

Tags examples:

  • item
  • quest
  • mission
  • potion

Tags with the name of the item are useless. I spent some time at one point to purge the tags list of them. If you search for something you can very well use the search box. There is no need to add 2 useless tags to it. It pollutes the tag cloud.

Thank you for your contributions.

item.title: Re: Tags
item.content:encoded:
Adding "Sharktooth" as a tag doesn't help people find the Sharktooth Necklace. One can easily find the Sharktooth Necklace by entering "Sharktooth" into the search box on the upper right, even without its getting its own tag.

There is also no particular utility in tagging all the necklaces in-game, though I will grant that if somebody were to tag all of them, it might have some value as trivia.

Tags are useful for categorization, for finding other members of a set. Tagging all eight Lost Weapons (and no other items) "lost-weapon" can be of use for those trying to get them all. On the other hand, adding "Jet" and "Set" as separate tags for Soundless Jade, as you have just done, certainly doesn't help anybody find that item. Tagging Book of the Twillight "lost-weapon," as you did the other day, is outright misleading, as it's nothing of the sort; as seen in the text for the Cursed Wave trophy, there are only eight of those. All superfluous tags do is add clutter and make the tag system less useful, making it harder to find the signal amongst the noise.

item.title: Tags
item.content:encoded:
The use of tags around the wiki is inconsistent at the moment, but I think it's safe to say that if a given tag is being used for only one page, the tag shouldn't be used at all. (e.g., there is no reason why "Sharktooth Necklace" would be tagged "sharktooth" or "necklace")

In general, I'd be inclined to stick with making the use of existing tags more consistent, rather than adding new ones wholesale. (e.g., if you notice that most trophies have the "trophy" tag, and one is missing it, go ahead and add it)
